entities: United Nations Office for West Africa and the Sahel (UNOWAS)
reporting_cycle: within ten (10) days after its adoption
summary:
The Security Council,

Reaffirming commitment to The Gambia's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity, 

Recalling the importance of good-neighbourliness, non-interference, and regional cooperation, 

Recalling previous statements on Peace consolidation in West Africa and Gambia elections, 

Recalling AU Charter and ECOWAS Protocol on Democracy and Good Governance, 

Congratulating the Gambian people on the peaceful and transparent Presidential election on 1 December 2016, 

Noting Mr. Adama Barrow's election as President, recognized by former President Yahya Jammeh, 

Strongly condemning Jammeh's statement rejecting election results, 

Condemning attempts to usurp the will of the people, undermine the electoral process, and prevent a peaceful transfer of power, 

Expressing grave concern at the risk of situation deterioration, 

Commending ECOWAS and AU initiatives for a peaceful transition, 

Urges all Gambian parties to respect the election outcome recognizing Adama Barrow as President-elect; 

Endorses ECOWAS and AU decisions to recognize Mr. Adama Barrow as President; 

Calls upon countries in the region to cooperate with President Barrow; 

Welcomes ECOWAS and AU decisions on The Gambia; 

Welcomes AU's declaration of the inviolable nature of the election outcome.
The Security Council:
 
- Notes the presidential elections held on 1 December 2016 in The Gambia, 
  calls upon former President Yahya Jammeh to respect his speech of 2 December 
  2016, and declares that as of 19 January 2017, Jammeh will cease to be 
  recognized as legitimate President.

- Expresses full support to ECOWAS in ensuring respect for the election results.

- Requests Jammeh to ensure a peaceful transfer of power to President Adama 
  Barrow by 19 January 2017, in accordance with the Gambian constitution.

- Emphasizes the importance of ensuring the safety of President Adama Barrow 
  and all Gambian citizens.

- Requests stakeholders to exercise restraint, respect the rule of law, and 
  ensure a peaceful transfer of power.

- Requests the Gambian defence and security forces to demonstrate maximum 
  restraint and place themselves at the disposal of the democratically elected 
  authorities.

- Requests the Secretary-General to update the Security Council within 10 
  days and facilitate political dialogue between Gambian stakeholders.

- Decides to remain seized of the matter.
